column4: periodically, ubuntu server connection drops on local network, any ideas? I have to bring down et1 the bring it back up again to restore the connection, but this is pretty inconvenient
every 20 minutes, there is output as "--MARK--", 7 entries. only other output is system restart
the --mark-- marks are there to let you know that the machine is still running (at least on the whole).
ok, I think this started when I installed bind9 to try to set up local dns. I uninstalled bind9 earlier and restarted the system, but the connection drop still happened...
when you say the connection drops, what do you mean?
i can't ping it from other machines on the network, though the ip address for the server still shows as reserved in the DHCP table of my router
also, ifconfig on the server still shows the correct ip address on eth1, as leased from the router
are you able to ping the router from the server?
haven't tried that, I will have to wait for the issue to happen again in order to test that unfortunately
I am not sure what triggers the problem
unfortunately, I'm going to have to close down now.  My eyes are starting to close on their own.
ok, no problem, you've given me some ideas. thanks for your help :)
